intro: Odontophyllum runcinatum, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, velvety leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often with a short, thick stem and rosette-forming foliage. Its flowers are usually purple or blue, with five petals and a distinctive spurred shape. Odontophyllum runcinatum is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
